DataElement.preferredName: Ability Take Enteral Route of Administration Medication Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The indicator of whether or not enteral medications were able to be taken.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Ability Take Enteral Route of Administration Medication
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: The quality of being able to perform; a quality that permits or facilitates achievement or accomplishment._As pertains to a medication: ingest, inhale, instill, or inject.:Administration of a substance by the way of the gastrointestinal tract, usually for systemic action. Drug bioavailability can be affected due to enzymatic degradation by intestinal tissues and microbes, and first-pass hepatic metabolism._A drug product that contains one or more active and/or inactive ingredients; it is intended to treat, prevent or alleviate the symptoms of disease. This term does not refer to the individual ingredients that make up the product.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: The quality of being able to perform; a quality that permits or facilitates achievement or accomplishment._As pertains to a medication: ingest, inhale, instill, or inject.

Concepts.definition: The quality of being able to perform; a quality that permits or facilitates achievement or accomplishment.
As pertains to a medication: ingest, inhale, instill, or inject.

Property.preferredDefinition: Administration of a substance by the way of the gastrointestinal tract, usually for systemic action. Drug bioavailability can be affected due to enzymatic degradation by intestinal tissues and microbes, and first-pass hepatic metabolism._A drug product that contains one or more active and/or inactive ingredients; it is intended to treat, prevent or alleviate the symptoms of disease. This term does not refer to the individual ingredients that make up the product.

Concepts.definition: Administration of a substance by the way of the gastrointestinal tract, usually for systemic action. Drug bioavailability can be affected due to enzymatic degradation by intestinal tissues and microbes, and first-pass hepatic metabolism.

A drug product that contains one or more active and/or inactive ingredients; it is intended to treat, prevent or alleviate the symptoms of disease. This term does not refer to the individual ingredients that make up the product.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).

ReferenceDocuments.name: PQT
ReferenceDocuments.description: Were enteral medications able to be taken?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is patient able to take enteral medications via oral (PO), nasogastric (NG) tube, nasojejunal (NJ) tube, nasoduodenal (ND) or gastrostomy tube (G-tube)?
